bibl.title: A Botanical Contribution to the Analysis of Subsistence and Trade at Berenike (Red Sea Coast, Egypt); - Discussion.
bibl.note: 1. Introduction. - 2. Subsistence. - 3. Trade. - 4. Conclusions. Local agriculture could have been practised on a small scale. Archaeobotanical research sheds new light on the import and export of plant products as described in the Periplus Maris Erythraei.

bibl.title: Life on the Fringe. Living in the Southern Egyptian Deserts during the Roman and Early-Byzantine Periods. Proceedings of a Colloquium Held on the Occasion of the 25th Anniversary of the Netherlands Institute for Archaeology and Arabic Studies in Cairo 9-12 December 1996

bibl.seg: CAPPERS R.T.J., A Botanical Contribution to the Analysis of Subsistence and Trade at Berenike (Red Sea Coast, Egypt); - Discussion.

Olaf E. KAPER (Ed.), Life on the Fringe. Living in the Southern Egyptian Deserts during the Roman and Early-Byzantine Periods. Proceedings of a Colloquium Held on the Occasion of the 25th Anniversary of the Netherlands Institute for Archaeology and Arabic Studies in Cairo 9-12 December 1996 = CNWS Publications. 71 (Leiden, 1998) pp. 75-86, 2 tabl.

1. Introduction. - 2. Subsistence. - 3. Trade. - 4. Conclusions. Local agriculture could have been practised on a small scale. Archaeobotanical research sheds new light on the import and export of plant products as described in the Periplus Maris Erythraei.
